page.title: 20Sheffield Canal
page.content: Demand from the rapidly expanding Sheffield steel industry in the early 19th C.led to a canal being built from the navigable Don at Tinsley to the Canal Basin in the City Centre, thus creating a water link to the North Sea. The canal, named the {"Sheffield {& South Yorkshire Navigation" }was 8ft. deep, had eleven locks, five of which were at Tinsley, and was opened in 1819. The rise in importance of the railways in the mid 19th C. led to the decline of the canal which fell into disrepair and became heavily polluted. In 1985 plans are well in advance to clean and repair the canal so that it may be developed for leisure activities. Already pleasure craft may be seen using the canal and the reintroduction of fish to the cleaner waters has enabled fishing matches to take place.
